Paralyzed Patient Thinks 'Walk,' and Then Walks
Posted: Mar 22, 2013 #Around the World

Thousands of people every year suffer spinal cord injuries and lose their ability to walk. An brain-controlled exoskeleton that moves a patient's legs could be one way to get some patients out of wheelchairs.
